notify.notSupportHid: This browser doesn't not support HID connection, please use Chrome, Edge or Opera browser to connect
notify.hidConfNotFound: No Valid HID Device Configuration Found
notify.fr_not_connect: Receiver not connected to the keyboard or the keyboard is in sleep mode.
notify.keyboard_not_support_wireless: The Keyboard FIrmware Not Support Wireless
notify.fr_not_connect_mouse: The mouse has entered sleep mode or changed the connection mode. Please reconnect the device to continue using it.

common.resolution_not_support: The keyboard map cannot be displayed because the browser window is too small.

keymap.knob_not_support: Current firmware does not support knob customization, please update the firmware.

layer.1: Temporarily activate layer n. Once the key is released, the layer will deactivate. The Fn key on the keyboard typically uses this setting.
layer.2: Change the state of layer n: if it is inactive, activate it; if it is active, deactivate it.
layer.3: When holding down this key, the layer will be activated and deactivated upon release (similar to MO). Repeated tapping will toggle the layer on or off (similar to TG). By default, this requires 5 taps.
layer.4: Temporarily activate layer n until the next key is pressed.
layer.5: Activate layer n and deactivate all other layers (except the default layer). This unique function allows a lower layer to replace a higher layer. It activates when the key is pressed (as long as the key is held down).
layer.6: Temporarily switch the default layer to layer n. Note that this is a temporary switch and will be invalid after the keyboard is powered off.

perkey.region_tip: Select the area in the keyboard keys and set the color. Click Save to change the color of the corresponding area.

macro.notEqual: Detect Flowing Key Is Not Release, Continues?
macro.loop_until_trigger_key_press: Loop Until Trigger Key Press Again

setting.unlockTip: Turn on the travel unlock to unlock the 0.2-0.4mm operation distance adjustment, at 0.2-0.4mm the trigger will become very sensitive and easy to accidentally touch, please pay attention after turning on.

distance.magnet_calibrate_tip: Trigger Demo supports only a single key
distance.magnet_calibrate_tip_desc: Select a key and turn on the switch button upper right to demonstrate the trigger of the selected key.
distance.desc: The shorter the trigger distance, the more sensitive the switch, requiring less pressing distance.
distance.speed_desc: Continuous pressing triggers dynamically. The shorter the trigger and reset distances, the more sensitive the switches become.
distance.profile_help: press "fn" + "p" + "z / x / c", you can quickly switch the profile to profile 1 / 2 / 3

multi_cmd.fulfilled: Space full. Delete existing command to set a new one.

titles.5: Enable if you can type while the joystick is being simulated, disable if you cannot type while the joystick is being simulated.

tips.0: There is no firmware update for the current device.

info.4: A new firmware version has been released.

tip.1: Windows users need to download Toolbox and install the built-in drivers in toolbox for the first time.

firmware.notSupport: This browser doesn't support Web USB. Please use other browsers, such as Chrome.
firmware.warning: Please refrain from removing the device or refreshing the page during the firmware writing process to prevent any potential damage to the device.

step.1: Unplug the USB cable with the keyboard
step.2: Import the firmware that needs to be flashed
step.3: Connect the device to retrieve the latest firmware version information.

mouse.upgrade_mode_warning1: After clicking the button below, the mouse will enter upgrade mode and will be temporarily unusable, requiring keyboard operation.
mouse.upgrade_mode_warning2: After entering upgrade mode, do not exit and follow the steps, otherwise, the mouse will not function properly.
mouse.unable_to_connect: If unable to click the connect device button, follow the steps below.
mouse.step1_hid_device: Press the D, M, S keys on the keyboard in order, and continue to the next step once the HID device connection prompt appears.
mouse.step2_hid_device: Use the Tab key on the keyboard to switch focus and select the mouse name to upgrade with the arrow keys.
mouse.step3_hid_device: After confirming the selection, press Enter to begin the firmware flashing process.

common.resetAll: This operation will delete all saved data. Continue?

dpi.dpiTip: Adjust the speed at which the mouse pointer moves in any direction, or configure its sensitivity level.
dpi.reportTip: Adjust how often the device sends reports back to the computer.

tip.6: This operation will delete saved data. Continue?
tip.8: Adjust mouse pointer movement speed or configure sensitivity levels
tip.9: Adjust the frequency of device-to-computer report feedback
tip.10: Distance after which mouse stops moving when leaving desktop, low: 1mm, high: 2mm
tip.11: The sensor will have a ripple effect when the DPI value is greater than 9000, improve this ripple, ignore this setting when DPI is less than 9000
tip.13: In eSports mode, both the sensor and the main controller enter the most active state for faster response, but this increases power consumption and reduces battery life. (Note: eSports mode is automatically activated when the polling rate exceeds 2KHz.)
tip.14: Correct offset at a certain angle to a straight line.
tip.15: Accuracy of sensor refresh cycle and discrete nature of sensor movement data.
tip.16: Receiver not connected to mouse or mouse is in sleep mode
tip.leftLock: Left-click configuration is locked and cannot be configured.

pair.pair_success: Pairing successful. If 2.4G mode is required, please re-plug the receiver.
pair.pair_start: Click the pairing button below to pair.
pair.select_receiver: Click the connect device button below and select the receiver device.
